author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFT-DAO EZ-Ticket dispenser
description: Ticket authenticity and scalping at much higher prices make it difficult to control who is buying, selling, or redeeming a ticket.

assessments.note: This is one of the weaker dApp use cases for the main reason you can create an NFT "ticket" and distribute them on the blockchain in an app already today, just using metadata/token minting. You dont need a decentralized contract for this in fact it arguable works worse in a decentralized way since you only would want a single issue (the event host) to be able to issue new tickets.
assessments.reply: Here we go with #60 again.  I submit #60 has a personal issue with us and should be banned from reviewing any of our proposals!  Clearly this CA doesn't understand scaling systems.  If there argument is true, it is like saying you can move an ADA from one wallet to another, therefore you don't need anything more for DeFi.  Please ban this reviewer.

assessments.note: NFT storefront facilitating smart ticketing has a worldwide appeal. With Cardano's state of art NFTs and low transaction fees, this system has the potential to attract wide adoptions. The NFT based tickets to cultural and sports events can open up the market for trading these tickets which are quite cumbersome today. The proposal is addressing a very important step in Cardano adoption.

This is a powerful use case for blockchain and the proposal does a good job of explaining the benefits to the industry, which should encourage adoption. Cardano is a perfect low cost platform to make the economics work.

This proposal is well structured, identified some existing problems in the ticket market and proposes a viable solution. By explaining the several components that the team wants to build they clearly articulate how they will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal fits well into the narrative of this challenge.

The problem and solution descriptions are clear and objective. The proposal indicates a direct relationship with this challenge and has the potential to bring many users and transactions to Cardano's blockchain through a relevant market. The goals described in the plan indicate the potential for significant impact.
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact a large community of people who buy tickets for events.

There is no technical documentation included in the proposal, there is a mention of an existing tokenized ticket system they plan to build to but with no detail into the mechanics of the system they are building this presented plan is not very compelling.
assessments.reply: Go away #60, just go away.  What is your real motive?  I'm happy to debate you in an open forum.

assessments.note: Whilst the proposers have the technical expereince to deliver on this, do they have domain experience/contacts to have it accepted in the industry? What is the slaes plan to get firms like ticketek to accept this? Would they not be happy with just a centralised solution?
assessments.reply: Glad you asked.  I host many annual events where tickets are a main part of the system.  I have direct experience related to managing, selling and utilizing ticket systems.

assessments.note: NFT-DAO claims the support of about 12 developers and it is very likely that technical expertise for developing the dapp will be present in-house. The proposal is not a very complex implementation of NFT with a smart contract. Therefore it will be possible to implement the proposal successfully.
The NFT DAO team is highly qualified and has a lot of momentum in the Catalyst community. The project is organized into 6 phases and has a clear timeline. I see the project as highly feasible.

What I like about this how they introduce a part of their team. The proposer are already in the NFT-DAO which shows that they are already commited to our community. It helps to built trust if a team submits their github which is the case here. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and the budget is reasonable. However I'd like to see a more detailed break-down how the funds are calculated. Maybe for the next time you submit a proposal you can try to add this to your proposal.
assessments.reply: Agreed, we are running estimates, not quotes.  Many of us have run dev shops and have a pretty realistic idea of the costs to build and market these kinds of solutions so we rely on our experience and also try to work within the Catalyst funding framework.

assessments.note:
The plan is very well structured and detailed. There are relevant details about the experience and qualifications of the main members of the NFT DAO, indicating their ability to implement this proposal successfully.

The NFT DAO is one of Fund3's winning proposals and has demonstrated excellent performance and achievements for the NFTs space on Cardano.

There are details on budget allocation.

There is a reasonable and well-defined timeline
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is good. The team has experience in the NFT Space.
The plan is not for the creation of a high-volume dApp on Cardano in the next 6 months. The team also fails to make it clear why this needs to be a decentralized application.
assessments.reply: Another clearly biased opinion from our friend number 60.  Not sure where high-volume is explicit, as volume and price aren't cojoined.   That said, can you tell me other dApps that have the potential of creating tens of thousands of NFTs for thousands of different event types? And how are you measuring high volume.  If I need to explain decentralization benefits to blockchain CAs and community then we have much bigger issues to deal with.  Please ban #60 from working on any NFT-DAO proposals, there is a clear violation of reason, ethics and morality going on with this individual.

assessments.note: Plan lacking in details on how to actually get the product accepted into what in the end is a highly centralised industry.
assessments.reply: Should the assessor know anything about the ticketing market or the NFT market, they would have been able to see that our model is not unique and has precedence as explained in this section: Tikkit.app will be one of the storefronts on the NFT Framework Collab. It will resemble https://www.nft.kred/events/tickets but on the Cardano blockchain and a better UX/UI and different features and use models. NFT.Kred is just an example.  We are not creating a new market, the market already exists, we are building a better alternative on the Cardano blockchain.  My marketing acumen is well established in botht he community and in the world at large.  This is not something being developed by novices, I've worked on 18 startups, clearly I have experience commercializing products.  I host several very large conferences every year, I'm not coming to this with no experience.  All of this is in the propasl if it ws read thoroughly.

assessments.note: The project has a well-laid road map with clear markers for measuring progress. It will be possible to measure the progress of the project quantitatively.

fund allocation is not broken down specifically, but the 6 phases allow for monitoring of progress. Software development can be monitored via github. Success reporting is defined at 3, 6 and 12 months. Given these resources it shouldn't be difficult to judge the success of the project.

There is a clear description of the proplem this proposal wants to tackle. They also describe how they want to achieve it. By breaking down their plan to Phase 1-6 they provide information of how their progress is supposed to look like. They provided 3 stages with metrics that define the succes of the proposal.

In general, the proposal describes many details that assist in auditability. There are details about the team, budget breakdown, relevant goals, a clear timeline with defined milestones.

I recommend only the inclusion of KPIs that allow a more objective audit.
The Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit.

solution: With NFTs, smart tickets are verifiable, interoperable and have clear ownership. A ticket redeemed at an event lives on in digital wallets.
experience: NFT-DAO has committed developers and over 30 qualified marketing, graphics and business professionals contributing to the NFT Framework.
